actions.committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Banking and Financial Services.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Banking and Financial Services
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Domestic and International Monetary Policy

official_title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that United States investors, lenders, and corporations should assume the full measure of risk and responsibility for their investments and loans in Mexico since the devaluation of the peso on December 21, 1994, and that loan guarantees that are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States and that could result in any direct or indirect financial obligation on the part of United States taxpayers should not be provided to the Mexican Government.

summary.text: Expresses the sense of the Congress that: (1) U.S. investors, lenders, and corporations in the private sector should assume the full measure of risk and responsibility for their investments and loans in Mexico since the devaluation of the peso on December 21, 1994; and (2) loan guarantees that are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States and that could result in any financial obligation on the part of U.S. taxpayers should not be provided to the Mexican Government in the aftermath of the devaluation of the peso.

titles.title: Expressing the sense of the Congress that United States investors, lenders, and corporations should assume the full measure of risk and responsibility for their investments and loans in Mexico since the devaluation of the peso on December 21, 1994, and that loan guarantees that are backed by the full faith and credit of the United States and that could result in any direct or indirect financial obligation on the part of United States taxpayers should not be provided to the Mexican Government.
